Reviews.Title: “Weekend Trip”
Reviews.Author: Jlmajestic
Reviews.Content: Great Location, Across from CBS City and close to all area attractions. The Tar Pits and Farmers Market! Clean Rooms Great Service and Morning Breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Pass This 1 BY”
Reviews.Author: Mike S
Reviews.Content: Stayed a total of 7 nights out of 13 we stayed on our trip to southern Calif. We booked thru Expedia.com. and choose this 1 due to its close location to CBS. We had tickets to The Price Is Right. Parking was free but almost impossible to get in and out, especially if you had to park in the basement. We had a small car and still had to strain. Housekeeping took our dirty wash cloths and didn't replace them with clean ones twice. Had to go to the front desk to get clean ones to shower the 1st time. The second time I refused to go and insisted that someone bring them up, waited nearly a half hour to get them. The front desk said they were too busy and couldn't leave. I had to threaten to contest the charge on the credit card to finally get someone to bring me a wash cloth so I could bathe. The room was VERY small. Also found a long dark hair that was hanging out of the corner of the shower. I left it there to see how many visits from the housekeeper before it was cleaned. It took 2 visits before it was cleaned. My friend and I have very short hair, so it definately wasn't ours. The Location is what keeps this place in business. I would NOT stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “More than what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: lolly a
Reviews.Content: I think what has happened to some of the people that have posted negative reviews about this place is that they have lost perspective. I have been lucky enough to stay in some beautiful hotels and this was definitely not one. However, I was not disappointed as I have spent more money on a pair of jeans. When you are looking at lodgings in this price range you don't want to compromise on a couple of things; cleanliness, location and bed bugs. The Rodeway Inn delivers on all of those things, plus you have pleasant staff, good tv and a nice little continental breakfast. Yes, it's not silver service, but when did you even get a free cup of coffee in another low end hotel? Keep perspective and you will be very happy with this little place. I would stay again. Also there is an big amazing health food shop across the street selling sushi, smoothies and all sorts till 11pm. As for the area, I stayed as a single (tiny) woman and did not feel uncomfortable or threatened at all.

Reviews.Title: “I would not stay here again...”
Reviews.Author: WanderingC
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night, and this was more than enough. The room was a good size, had coffee maker, fridge, and small microwave. All seemed well until it was time to go to go to sleep... the walls are paper thin, we could hear the fan in the bathroom from the room next to ours, which was on for an hour. When our neighbors turned the fan off, we could hear people walking the floor above, as it kept creaking with every step. Around two a.m., someone decided to turn on their television, at a very loud level. We called the front desk, but no one answered the phone, after being told the desk was manned 24 hours a day. We went to the front desk, and the guy came to our room to hear the loud tv. He stated that he would go find which room it was emitting from and have them lower the volume. Around 15 minutes later, nothing had changed. I called the front desk again, but surprise, no answer. We ended up walking the hallway, and finally figuring out it was from the floor above, went and found the room, and called it ourselves. The woman who answered stated that it could not be her tv, but I told her what was playing, and she was shocked. After she lowered the volume, she told me she would not but it any lower, and to have a good night. Three hours sleep for one night is not my ideal, but stay here if it is yours.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: MrsmacAus
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in January and we were pleased we did. I booked over the phone from Australia and the receptionist-Cristine was lovely. This hotel was clean and comforatble and the continental breakfast was really handy and saved us money. Location was great too as we could walk to the Grove and the Farmer's market easily. It was also really safe- my daughter and I were quite comfortable walking around the area at night. There was a homeless guy living in the bus shelter under our window but he seemed harmless!

Reviews.Title: “Tell your friends”
Reviews.Author: Bryan H
Reviews.Content: Rooms were nice and clean. The location is excellent if you like to do the whole tourism scene. Close to The Grove and Farmers Market. Right across the street from CBS Studios. Minutes away from the Beverly Center and other shopping. Several nice restaurants within walking distance. Nice continental breakfast (Coffee, Cereal, Danishes, Mini muffins, toast, juices). Staff was very friendly and the price was very reasonable for the area. Would definitely stay again and recommend to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Red456838
Reviews.Content: Priced reasonably, located across from C studios and central to Hollywood Blvd & Beverly Hills and within walking distance of the famous Farmers Market, this older inn provides clean spacious rooms and free parking, WiFi and continental breakfast (juice, coffee, Danishes). We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Stay”
Reviews.Author: Nonniekash
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a Ritz Carlton on a shoestring budget, this hotel is not for you. But if you're on a tight budget and want to spend more money on something other than lodging, this Rodeway Inn may just be the answer for you. I stayed there with a friend for four nights and we were completely satisfied with the state of our room, the cleanliness of the facility, the attentiveness of the staff, and the super location to The Grove, Farmer's Market, CBS Studios, and Museum Square. My friend and I (both of us are women) never felt unsafe walking around at night. There were always lots of people on the streets. This Rodeway Inn was perfect for us and our pocketbooks. No pool, fitness or business center. Continental breakfast with coffee, danish, bagels, mini-muffins, and packaged envelopes of oatmeal. Here's a bonus: Just three blocks away on Fairfax, you will find Canters Deli, an LA landmark, open 24-hours with the most wonderful assortment of Jewish delicacies. Our plates were heaping with generous portions.

Reviews.Title: “No parking for non-compacts, no closet, dbl bed instead of queen, fuzzy tv reception”
Reviews.Author: BlueBeamette
Reviews.Content: The room was tiny, we paid for a queen bed, (they don't have King size beds), but it was a double, the bathtub stopper didn't work, the tv had fuzzy reception, there wasn't any closet, just hooks on the wall. And finally, we said we could not stay there unless we could park somewhere, as street parking is not allowed for long periods and had meters... there was a risk of being towed. The steep driveway to the underground garage had signs saying it was for compact vehicles only. The desk person said we could have her space in the rear alley at 11pm when her shift ended. She called us to say she was leaving at 10:58pm.. we went down at 11:05 and someone had taken the place... we complained, but were told there wasn't anything they could do. We parked on the street and had to move the car twice... and still ended up hauling luggage etc down the street to our car. Oh yeah -the floor creaked at every step. and although we received a call from the front desk, when we tried to call them back the phone would not work!

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant stay!”
Reviews.Author: Marie K
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights, everything was lovely. The staff was very helpful and the room was clean. Location was great.

Reviews.Title: “Dont stay here”
Reviews.Author: EVANNY
Reviews.Content: The Good: We stayed here because it was CHEAP and location was GOOD (ie: 2 blocks away from the good area). So that's your two positives. The TV is good (flat screen, lots of channels) The BAD: Room smelled of smoke. Breakfast was non existent (Coffee and very sweet danish, and super sugary juice box), area was sketchy at night (lots of homeless around, one man even came for breakfast!), people were loud at night, front staff didnt care. The Ugly: The fridge and AC made a lot of noise at night too, bathroom dirty. If you just want CHEAP and are here 1 night, great.. I was here 3 nights (Aug 18-21/2011) and didnt sleep well because of the noises/people around.. seriously was holding on to my husband in the night and wished we payed a little more to go elsewhere..

Reviews.Title: “Stay away”
Reviews.Author: felixTO
Reviews.Content: We had two rooms during our stay. Our room smelt like urine and my parent’s room had mice. Cockroaches were also seen in the hallway. Breakfast was ok with toast and bagels however, it seemed like it was a constant battle with children either living or visiting at the hotel. After a week it really took its toll and I started to get frustrated and wonder where their parents were. This may be just bad timing during our stay but it was clear that the staff knew these children and should be aware that they were quite disruptive to our stay. Location is within walking distance to the Grove and the Farmers Market. Free Wifi. Free Parking (although as noted by other posts, VERY tight). Front desk staff was helpful with suggestions on where to go and what to see. Final opinion: spend the extra money and find a different motel.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, clean, great location, and no bedbugs”
Reviews.Author: msperop
Reviews.Content: I came by and checked out room before i booked since I was already in LA and wanted to move to a different location. I was surprised since some of the reviews are bad. We booked a two bed room which ended up having a small bedroom inside so it was two rooms, two tvs, two dressers, two ac units....very roomy! We had one bathroom, one fridge, and one microwave and free wifi in the room. Also, a free daily basic breakfast (bagels, toast, cereal, oatmeal, mini-chocolate muffins, and pre-packaged danishes. Also, coffee, milk, oj, and apple juice.) It was a great basic room, that was clean, and no bedbugs. I always check beds first. They had the mattress covers to prevent bedbugs. I was surprised to read someone's review of the area as interesting....this was a great neighborhood to stay in...there was a park a block away, the farmer's market/the grove about two blocks away and the beverly center shopping about a ten minute walk. This is a pretty nice area if you are trying to book with a budget. Now, it's not accessible to the metro rail so if you are using public transportation, plan on walking or getting a metro pass. I would definitely stay again! Stairwell was not creepy...I was a single woman with a teenage son. My husband stayed home and we did not have any safety concerns at all. I was in LA for a total of three weeks and only came here the last week and I wish I had stayed here all three weeks.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: jene2011
Reviews.Content: We had one night stay, it was really nice, the location was great, room was very clean, they had a little continental breakfast which is nice, and the staff was nice and helpful at least we could tell they tried their best to help us with anything.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: RDHLa
Reviews.Content: Good location, friendly staff, clean room, reasonable price. Will come back in the future.

Reviews.Title: “BEG BUGS!”
Reviews.Author: Sally0815
Reviews.Content: DO NOT STAY HERE! My room had bed bugs. For anyone who doesn't realize the implications of this, not only do beg bugs leave bites all over your body, they do not just stay in the bed but can get in the carpet and more importantly, in the seams of your clothes and suit case so your luggage can get infested, you can bring them back to your house and have an infestation at home within a matter of time, which is extremely costly to get rid of. My clothes and suit case are currently now all sealed in garbage bags outside my house, and I am contemplating home treatment or calling an exterminator which will be hundreds of dollars. Needless to say, I regret staying here beyond belief. Aside from the bed bugs, the room itself smelled and none of us staying there got any sleep between the extremely LOUD traffic and street noise and the bed bugs.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of the driveway into the parking garage.”
Reviews.Author: 4tomorrow
Reviews.Content: The room was clean and fine for our one night stay. However, I read on Trip Advisor that the driveway into the parking garage was small and to take heed. We drive a Mercury Grand Marquis, and we tried our best to be careful, but we still scraped our front fender coming out of the garage.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, cheap, and that's about it”
Reviews.Author: On_Holiday_154
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a weekend in March '11. The rooms were super clean and mine was a decent size. Pluses? Clean, convenient to downtown, good wireless (free), and inexpensive. Minuses? Creepy stairwell and elevator, "interesting" neighborhood, bad coffee, nothin' breakfast. Worth it for the price, but next time I need to be in downtown LA, I'm going to spend the extra $$.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here - tiny rooms and very poor hygiene.”
Reviews.Author: EmilieYoung
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are on our honeymoon and stayed at this hotel very recently. We originally booked for 4 nights but after seeing our room, we decided to check out early and stay somewhere else! The room smelled musty and wet. The room itself was tiny, we were tripping over each other and our luggage, and we felt like we were going to the toilet, eating and sleeping in the same 3meter x 3meter space! The bathroom sink had a decent sized hole in it, and cracks all up the bathroom side. We could hear other peoples conversations from inside our room, and the cleaners conversations outside our room and along the hall. The location was very seedy, despite being close to the Grove and to CBS. We woke up to a raid next door to the hotel with police everywhere at about 2am that night. Also, as we did not have a "compact" car we had to park behind the hotel in nonsecure parking, which was a very dodgy non lit alley way. Bottom line, if you have a choice, DO NOT STAY HERE!!! Ironically, there are cheaper and much nicer hotels to stay at which are all around the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room and Hotel Location for the Price, but.....”
Reviews.Author: travelingheels007
Reviews.Content: Being a woman traveling alone for a business trip my main concerns were safety of the neighborhood and hotel facilities & commuting ease to where I was going to conduct business which was right down the street at the Sofitel Hotel. Although I'm not sure how large the other rooms are compared to mine that had a queen-sized bed, the hotel is fairly small and quaint. So if you'll be traveling with a family or a group of people who'll be staying in the same room with you--you may want to consider staying at other hotels in the LA area that are more spacious. Even if another person stays in the same room with you, it may feel a tad bit crowded at times. Overall, my hotel stay was great. I stayed in room 205--and it was very clean, cozy, and quaint which fit perfect for me since I was traveling alone. The room had a microwave and mini refrigerator, and the restroom was nice and spacious. The only issue I had, was that there are 3 entrances to the hotel (the main one facing Beverly Blvd., another on the backside of the property where the small parking lot is located, and a 3rd entrance on the side facing a side street). My trip was mainly business, but there were a few cocktail party events in the evening so 2 of the 3 nights I stayed there--I returned to my hotel after 1 a.m.. Each of those times that I returned to my hotel--the side entrance glass door was wide open and at no time was it ever even closed for the safety of guests. After I noticed this occurrence on the 2nd night I became a bit concerned because I figured that it was normal that the staff kept it open. Anyone off the street could just walk inside the building and do something bad to an unsuspecting hotel guest. Furthermore, there is no security guard on the premises. So in case your wondering, would I stay there again--NO--only because of this safety issue. Other than that, I would definitely stay there again because everything else was perfect. Thank God while I was there I didn't become a statistic. Happy Hotel Hunting!! =)

Reviews.Title: “Great Hollywood Location, Sad Motel”
Reviews.Author: JohninTX
Reviews.Content: The plus side of this motel is the location - a very safe, pleasant neighborhood near the trendy "Grove" shopping center and directly across the street from CBS Television City where "American Idol," "Dancing With the Stars, and "The Price is Right" are taped. Speaking of price, the motel is cheap... and unfortunately, you get what you paid for. The room was extremely small, by far the smallest hotel/motel room I have ever seen. The heater/air unit was literally about 2 feet from the bed. The air would have blown directly into our faces the whole night if we hadn't covered the unit up with pillows. The bathroom fan rattled. The dresser drawers didn't shut properly. The ceiling light had florescent bulbs, which only "highlighted" just how depressing the whole room was. The subterranean parking is only for compact vehicles, and that is no exaggeration. There were numerous scrape marks on the parking ramp walls from past unlucky drivers. If you have anything bigger than a Honda Civic, I wouldn't chance it. To get to the elevator from the parking garage, guests must navigate a very dingy basement with unmarked rooms that are probably being used for the workers. I would recommend this only to people who need to get to sleep immediately and then get out of there as quickly as possible. FYI, the Beverly Inn Motel, also on the block and about the same price, looked even worse. If location isn't your first priority but pricing is, I'd recommend a Motel 6.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in a clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jimmsocal
Reviews.Content: Rooms are small but very clean. Free covered parking. Half the price of other hotels inn the area.

Reviews.Title: “PLEASANT”
Reviews.Author: nocturnal86
Reviews.Content: My meeting was held at the Convention Center Downtown LA and I knew that all the Hotel's are busy and taken and I also did not want to spend to much money for a room that I would not be in all the time beside just to sleep in. Rodeway inn was affordable and friendly. They might not be a 5 star hotel so I did not expect much but the breakfast, free parking, and the wifi internet being free just surprised me for the money. The front desk people werew nice and friendly they try there best to accomodate for others. But it is understandable if somethings they cant do. Overall I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Okay - for one night”
Reviews.Author: gymath
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nothing fancy! Just a one night stop for us....and that was more than enough. Traveled with husband and children ages 10 & 11. Husband was going to Price is Right in morning, and it's right across the street. A small walk. Checked in after long flights from the East Coast. Lady at desk was pleasant enough. Room was small, neat and clean. Huge bathroom. View of scary alley.....kept shutters closed....didn't want to scare the kids. ha-ha! Microwave and frig. We slept well, but struggled with the time change from the east coast! Woke in the morning and made several trips back and forth to the breakfast spot in the lobby. Food was simple.....wrapped danishes, fruit, oatmeal packets, cereals, toast, bagels, milk, coffee, juice. Happy to have the food because we hadn't found a store yet. No where to sit unless you went outside. Outside area looked fine.....kind of a patio type of thing. The lobby did come with it's own bum! No joke. There was a bum looking man sitting in the lobby, next to the desk sleeping...snoring as we got our breakfast. The clerk behind the counter didn't seem to mind him there....kind of like he was a regular! The lobby was glassed off and had an access window for the lady behind the counter....I'm guessing they must lock the lobby access off at night and have guests check in from the hallway side window at a bullet proof looking type of window. Hotel doors were wide open, anyone could have walked in and went to one of the rooms. The weather was cool, so I guess the fresh air and light were refreshing. The halls are narrow and crappy looking. I find it hard to believe that Choice Hotels has this place listed as a 3. I can't even believe it's a Choice Hotel. I wouldn't stay here again unless we were doing the Price is Right show again. It was good for doing the show. Husband went and got in line at about 5 AM, got his numbered ticket, then came back to hotel and had breakfast with us. Helped me check out of the hotel and load up the car. I took the kids 5 miles up the road into Culver City and saw five tapings of Are You Smarter Than A 5th Grader. He went back to his show to get in line around 8:30 AM. Then we hooked up with husband later and headed to our next stop on our trip. Oh, and I could NOT get my computer to work in the room....not sure if it was their internet problem or my computer knowledge problem! (It was a new toy for me!) Neighborhood is rather run down....almost ghetto.....but not horrible. Seriously, just a one night stop kind of place. Sleep, Shower, Leave. No Pool. Pretty junky looking....but once in room, felt more at ease. Outside of room, scary. Free parking. Yeah, garage was small, but was good enough for us....our rental car was small. Price was $107.72 with AAA discount.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place!”
Reviews.Author: Weshy
Reviews.Content: I did, i loved this place, I think I had a nice stay, a clean, comfortable and convenient room, the staff were lovely and helpful, the location is great, very close to everything and I definitely would come back for the future needs.

Reviews.Title: “Welcome to the Cockroach Motel”
Reviews.Author: porcheezi
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the hotel everything looked great. The room with two beds had adequate space. All was well, until I went to take a bath and found a small cockroach in the tub...YUCK! I laid in my bed pondering if I should bring this up to the staff that night or try my best to sleep and tell them in the morning. Well, the decision on that one was made when I looked over next to the heater and there was a HUGE cockroach on the wall. I freaked out of course, and went over and smashed it (literally to pieces). I then went down to the front desk to tell them what had happened and they told me that they were surprised because they have never had a problem with roaches in the past. (Not true if you read through some of the other reviews) Also, they said that they couldn't do anything about getting me another room unless they could come into my room and take a picture of it. How ridiculous! And in the end they didn't reaccommodate us because they didn't have anymore rooms. The location was excellent because we went to the price is right the next morning, and is worth it if you want to save money and don't mind some extra company....as for me, I will NEVER, EVER stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: pepdawg33
Reviews.Content: We booked it for the Price is Right, and were happy to find we were right across the street and a 5 minute walk to the ticket place. We had requested a room with 2 double beds, and were happy to find a nice room with a queen bed, tv and desk, with an adjoining room with another queen bed, tv and fridge. They shared one bath, but we were very comfortable. The only downfall was the parking. There is a tiny lot under the building that is scary to drive into....if I had a large car I wouldn't even try it. Although it is free, there are limited spaces and we grabbed the last one of the evening. Great location for Price is Right and a quick drive to popular spots in Hollywood.

Reviews.Title: “Not nearly as bad as some reviews say.”
Reviews.Author: boygrrl
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a good friend while on a road trip from Seattle to San Diego in January 2007. We hadn't booked anything in advance and we weren't aware of tripadvisor.com, so by chance we rode past this Inn and decided to stay here. It's not fancy at all, but that's to be expected for these prices. We had a "suite" with both of us having our own bedroom with TV and a bath in between. It was clean enough, no dirt or cockroaches to be seen. The bed was perfectly okay, not the best bed ever, but I slept well. It was really quiet in my room, but my friend got woken up by a Mexican women at 5 am who continued to talk loudly on the phone in Spanish for the next five hours. So yes, the walls are kinda thin, but again that's to be expected from a property in this price range. The location was good for our purpose. We went to Santa Monica, Hollywood, Berverly Hills and a concert at the El Rey (Mid-Wilshire region). The neighbourhood is safe as far as we could see. We (two 25 year-old guys) never felt threatened during our three night stay. And we even walked back from Sunset one night. Front desk was pleasant. They called a cab for us when we asked. We didn't use their breakfast. And then finally: THE GARAGE. It was perfectly fine, we always had a spot, although admittely we did travel in January, which is probably the least busiest month of the whole year. As for the entrance being difficult to manoeuvre, not if you have a regular car. The scratches are probably mostly from people driving SUVs in which case its their own fault for driving such ridiculously huge cars. Concluding, this hotel isn´t that bad for the traveller who expects a clean bed at an okay location for a fine price.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the money”
Reviews.Author: DWJK
Reviews.Content: Very convenient location. Clean, comfortable. Friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “A benchmark for horror . . .”
Reviews.Author: Sharonae
Reviews.Content: OK. It's our fault. We had to be in LA for one night, for one dread event, and didn't want to spend any money. So I [it's really my fault. . .] opted for the cheapest place. $65 or so for a hotel across from CBS on Fairfax. Half of what anything decent charges. [If I had it to do over again, I'd have sprung for $200 to avoid re-living that night.] In my defense, I looked at the hotel photos on the 'net and booked a room based on faith that the photos had something to do with the hotel. The whole place was tiny, cramped, claustrophobic, ill-kept and with staff who obviously wished they were somewhere else. I felt sorry for them. Parking is also tiny and cramped, but is under the hotel and free. The room is a couple of feet larger than a queen bed. The window opens to an alley and a building next door. My husband woke me with a nightmare he was locked in a cell. I forget whether breakfast food was offered. We were in Malibu by sunrise.

Reviews.Title: “Roches, Roches!!”
Reviews.Author: haroldkerr
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good location, however everything was ruined when I saw roaches crawling on the floor. Then it got worse - when I was packing to leave, I picked my bag up from the floor and three roches crawled out of my bag. So, I had to empty all of my bags and shake them out. A couple more roaches fell out. Then, it got worse again. When I got home - 12 hours later - I set my bags on the front stoop of my house, I went to turn the hose on, and when I got back to the stoop, I saw yet another roach crawling in my bag! So, I had to go to Safeway and buy some Raid, and I took everything out of my bags, on the front stoop with a flashlight, and then I had to spray both of my bags with Raid and put my clothes in the washer! Needless to say, the cheaper price of the room is not worth bring home roaches. Also, the hotel has 30 some rooms, but the there are only about 12 spaces to park in their garage. I got in late one night and had to find a spot in the neighborhood about two blocks away. I would not stay in the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Should've believed the reviews!”
Reviews.Author: ordgal97
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights in May to go to The Price is Right. The only good thing about this place was the location. Room was so small I had to put my suitcase on top of the desk/dresser. Had to turn sideways to walk between that and the bed. The bathroom was tiny - if you're a large person, good luck with that! The continental breakfast was a laugh - they had bread but no toaster; had cereal the first morning of my stay, but none by the second. Do believe the reviews about the underground garage - it has maybe 12 spaces, and is very tight to get into & out of. You can see the scrapes on the walls where some people didn't quite make it! Luckily I just left the car parked for both days. Also the directory I found in the lobby stated this location had free local calls, that was not true. All in all, if you can get it cheap enough & just want to sleep, thats about the only way I'd recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: bigredapple
Reviews.Content: this little hotel is not the fanciest place by any stretch but is perfect for location , is in a quiet neighbourhood , has very nice staff and is a half a block from the transit system to go any where you need to go. the CBS studio is across the street and behind that is the farmers market with shopping and great market style eating you can't go wrong for the price!!!

Reviews.Title: “No frills and okay if you keep your expectations low”
Reviews.Author: ryanw12376
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for several days and changed rooms once because the phone didn't work (I didn't mind changing rooms since the first room I was in was so small). This first room was so small that there was basically just enough room to walk around the queen size bed. There was a fridge and microwave squeezed in the room though, along with reliable free wireless internet. The rooms did not, however, have irons and ironing boards (which I needed) so I asked the front desk and they lent me one to use that I had to return when I was done. There is apparently a complimentary continental breakfast offered but I never tried it. The front desk staff was generally courteous. After my first night in the tiny room I asked to change rooms on the pretense that I wanted one with a working phone (normally I wouldn't care and would just use my cell phone). The second room was much larger and actually felt like a real hotel room. Overall, the place had a bit of a run down feel, with a thin flimsy blanket on the bed with an occasional small hole, presumably from a cigarette. The place seemed reasonably clean (at least I didn't see any obvious danger signs such as cockroaches or anything like that). The walls and doors seemed thin but the place was quiet throughout my stay. The parking garage is quite narrow/small but I managed to drive in and out of it for several days without scraping up my car. One of the stairways leading up to the hotel from the parking garage smelled very bad (like a port-o-potty) but the other stairway up was all right. Finally, this hotel is most definitely NOT in Beverly Hills (though it is on Beverly Blvd). It is across from CBS Television City.

Reviews.Title: “just OK”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here because it was convenient. Not the best place we have ever stayed. Room very small, with sink in the bedroom not the bathroom. Wanted to open a window instead of the air-conditioner but the screen was ripped and our room looked out on a barbedwire fence. It was adequate, coffee and waffles, toast or cereal, pretty good. Small courtyard for eating. Probably would not stay there again, would look for something a little more upscale. Price was good but would rather pay a little more and get more.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad.”
Reviews.Author: MKeebler
Reviews.Content: The main guy at the desk, Krishna, was very unhelpful. It took almost an hour to check in. He didn't seem to know what he was talking about. Refused to accept the coupon. Could not offer extra room keys. Be Careful parking in the garage. Parking is limited. The entrance is super narrow & it's hard to get in & out. Ask to park in the back. Clean rooms, free breakfast, walking distance to The Grove shopping center. They'll try to upsell you to the suite which is the same as the room with 2 beds, only with a thin wall separating the beds.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny rooms! Nice staff!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: For the price you pay, this hotel could recieve an "average" rating. It is kept as clean as it can be, being that it appears to be an older building. Our room was SO TINY with a small double bed where the front door almost hits the side of the bed when you come in. There is a desk chair, TV, and sink in the sleeping room. Small bathroom with shower only. It was clean and well-stocked. We did not go to the free continental breakfast. The parking garage is a nightmare - small cars only! Tight - tight - tight - ramp down to parking spaces. If the garage is full, it is a real challenge to back out. There appears to be some parking on the street, tho. The good part: So close to CBS Studios and "The Price is Right". Tip for getting on the show: line up EARLY! I'm talking 3am! We lined up at 6am and did not get in (Feb 24). Anyway, this hotel is also close to/easy walking distance to Farmer's Market (lotsa fun) and The Grove, which is an upscale shopping/restaurant area. There is also a Subway and an Italian sandwich/pizza place (good food) a block or two down the street. The front desk people were friendly and helpful. I probably would not stay here again, only because of how small the rooms are but maybe there are larger ones available ???? Good luck and have a great time in LA. Rick and Laurie, Renton WA

Reviews.Title: “Don't let the Beverly Hills fool you!”
Reviews.Author: MovingtoCA
Reviews.Content: This is NOT in Beverly Hills and most certainly NOT a "hotel". It's more along the lines of seedy motel. The location of this establishment is ok. It is within walking distance to CBS studios (across the street) and the Farmer's Market. The room we stayed in was very very small-but clean. Bring your own towels because the ones they provide are very threadbare and dingy. There really wasn't anywhere to place our luggage. Parking is free (which is nice) but I'd park my car on the street rather than in their garage again. It's extremely difficult to exit the underground garage without scraping your car.

Reviews.Title: “Right across from 'The Price is Right' line up!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as we were trying to get onto "The Price is Right". So it served it's purpose well. The room was small but clean. Walls were little thin and we could hear our neighbours TV. This inn is right across and around corner from line up to get into show so it was perfect.If I was going to try and get onto show again I would stay here.

Reviews.Title: “An alright stay”
Reviews.Author: ijiZoRaSouRiTiji
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here twice in the past year, the first time due to the convenience of location (you really can walk to the Farmers Market and the Grove, and I also walked a few blocks up to Melrose Ave. as well). The first time I was impressed with what I got for the price I paid (about $60 on the website)--the room I received was fairly large with a fridge and clean bathroom. Based on this, I didn't hesitate much to stay here a second time--but this second time around the room I received was much smaller ("cramped" might be a better adjective!), and we had a few problems with the room key not opening our door. We also had a car--be warned, although parking is free, it is TIGHT--it took a good 10 minutes or so to get up the ramp from below!! To sum it up: it's an alright place in a good and quiet location, but it's more "motel" than "hotel."

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all cost!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in January 2004. This is the worst place I've ever stayed at in my life. The room was extremely cramped, no bigger than a jail cell. The TV didnt come with a remote. The towels were dingy. They have the audacity to tell you you arent allowed to have any visitors or you will be kicked out. The parking garage is cramped as well. I mean you could see where many cars had scraped the sides. I ended up parking on the street for the night. The employees speak with a thick Indian accent, you can barely understand them and are rude to boot. I don't know why this is called "GuestHouse- Beverly Hills". It is NOT in Beverly Hills. Its "down the road" from Beverly Hills. And that "stretch of road" makes ALL the difference! I would not recommend staying here at all. I dont care how cheap you can get it, avoid it at all cost. My reservation was originally for 3 nights, I stayed there for one and found a much better place in North Hollywood.

Reviews.Title: “Just for location”
Reviews.Author: glacierlady
Reviews.Content: Overall it fit the purpose ..cheap and around the corner from CBS studios.I didn't like the sink being in the sleeping area instead of in the bathroom and barely warm water in the morning.Cigarette burns in carpet and bedding.(smoking room)No pool.Parking garage is small with a scarey ramp,little cars only.Great cold air conditioning!I would stay there again just for location.

HotelInfo.Name: Rodeway Inn Los Angeles
HotelInfo.Address: 7721 Beverly Blvd, Los Angeles, CA 90036
